history.content:
I took 162 and 161 at the same time, and am presently a TA for 168 so I feel qualified to answer this. In my opinion this is very do-able if you are a strong programmer and have done well in other project-centric courses. One important thing to note is that it's very important that you find a good team for 162 – doing so will make your life much easier, and IMO helps you learn more and makes the class more fun.

The only potential difficulty is that deadlines for 162 and 161 projects tend to line up pretty closely – my advice would be to knock out the 161 projects super early so you have as much time as possible to work on 162 with your team. 168 is definitely the lightest upper-div CS class in terms of week-to-week work, but you have to prioritize studying for the exams when they roll around.

children.subject: Not the student answerer, but yes. They aren't perhaps project-heavy to the extent of, say 162, 184, 169, 160 etc. where the projects are often larger, come with less guidance, and sometimes constitute a majority of your grade (though for instance 161 doesn't throw a project, HW, and exam at you all at the same time, as 61C might), but yes they are generally along the lines of a project-heavy course. A lot of EECS dept courses that are p-set/exam heavy have 1 small project or no project at all and those are the ones that aren't project centric. You can use your  61C and 61B to gauge roughly how an UD project-heavy course will be like (sort of, there is sometimes a slight difference between the nature of the LD and UD projects). Note also that project centric doesn't always mean higher workload, i.e. the student answer on 168 being lower workload despite being "project-centric"
To the student's response above, do CS61B and CS61C count as project-centric courses?
(I would note that i consider 161 to be trivial compared to 186)
186 is so hard this semester lmao
I am in 162 168 and 186 and 16a this semester and its doable. I am doing well in all three of the courses (dont care about 16a)

history.content:
Hello,

Has anyone taken 162, 161 and 168 in one semester and would you recommend it?

Thanks!
history.subject: Three EECS Upper-Divs
